description: This Leicestershire village is nicely positioned for some fine canal and country walking. This circular walk from Kibworth Beauchamp takes you to the nearby Saddington Reservoir before heading to the lovely Foxton Locks on the Grand Union Canal. The walk starts by heading south from Kibworth Beauchamp to Smeeton Westerby. Here you can pick up the Saddington Road, a pleasant country lane which will lead you west to Saddington. On the way you'll cross the Grand Union Canal near Saddington Tunnel, where there are pleasant walks along the towpath. This route continues to Saddington village where you can pick up the Leicestershire Round and follow the waymarked footpath to the reservoir. The trail then heads south east to Smeeton Gorse and Gumley before coming to the splendid Foxton Locks. Here you'll find a country park with waterside trails, woodland paths and a photogenic staircase of locks.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the north west you can visit the interesting hamlet of Wistow. In the area there's nice waterside walks along the Grand Union Canal and the River Sence. There's also the Wistow Maze, a Rural Centre with a large garden centre, a model village, a cafe/bistro, a Mediterranean deli and an art gallery. For more walking ideas in the area see the Leicestershire Walks page.

display_address: Kibworth Mead Academy, Smeeton Road, Kibworth, Kibworth Beauchamp, Smeeton Westerby, Harborough, Leicestershire, England, LE8 0LG, United Kingdom
